col1: Taxon group of consumer
Identity of the focal consumer
Citation identifiyer
ID for replicate survey within a study
NA if only 1 survey was performed, otherwise whether survey represents spatial or temporal replicate
Whole-, sub-population or individual (eg. male/female, breeding/non-breeding, age, size, etc.)
(open list) Male, Female, Adult, Juvenile, Breeding, Non-breeding
highest resolution recorded in prey data (eg. species)
how much time do diet/abundance data represent. Rounded down to the next order of magnitude)

how much space to diet/abundance data represent - magnitude in square meters: round down to the next order of magnitude (think about in terms of what spatial scale a predator is foraging at, eg. snail vs. lion)
Method by which consumption was inferred (no percent diet or poop data allowed)
your best guess as to whether the diet data corresponds to the post-capture rate limiting step
Report latitude as decimal degrees to 2 decimal places
Of environment at time of survey (Degrees celsius).  Use mid-point if range provided.
in the same paper (incl. digestion times)
in the same paper (of prey and/or consumers)
Year (or the mid-point of a range of years) in which survey was conducted
Month (or the mid-point of a range of months) in which survey was conducted
Day (or the mid-point of a range of days) in which survey was conducted
Hour (or the mid-point of a range of hours) in which survey was conducted (Day = 12, Night = 24)
Second (or the mid-point of a range of seconds) in which survey was conducted
anything else that's useful (e.g., % of non-countable diet items)
